posts.post_content:
This is [Face of Fear](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Face of Fear)-level bad. Sure, this always has its evasion, but the blocking part is pretty stupid.  
  
Come to think of it, they have the same body for the same cost, color notwithstanding.

posts.post_content:
When I was reading this card I was thinking: 3/4 for 6 mana, so that's terrible. Which means that it will have all sorts of flavorful excellent abilities! This is awesome!

Hang on. Wait. A DRAWBACK? What is this, a coup-de-grace? Getting this card in a booster would be downright insulting.

Posted By: LordOfTheFlies87 (7/11/2013 9:05:42 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
So... another Cyclops tribal seed for the Theros block? Maybe? So far we also have [Borborygmos Enraged](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Borborygmos Enraged), [Fortress Cyclops](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fortress Cyclops),  [Nivix Cyclops](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Nivix Cyclops). Overcosted 4 color un-synergistic deck for the win?  
  
Joking aside, if there's even a hint of good Cyclops cards in the next block, or \*fingers crossed\* a Cyclops lord, this   
a) might be minorly playable in a tribal deck  
b) I'm going to be that much more excited that I pulled a [Door of Destinies](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Door of Destinies) at the pre-release.  
  
I think there's one more piece a (presumably R/G, or R/W) overcosted big stomp deck is gonna need for Standard constructed: some freaking ramp. Seriously, what did M14 give us to replace [Farseek](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Farseek)? [Lay of the Land](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lay of the Land)? Geez.
posts.html:
So... another Cyclops tribal seed for the Theros block? Maybe? So far we also have Borborygmos Enraged, Fortress Cyclops, Nivix Cyclops. Overcosted 4 color un-synergistic deck for the win?

Joking aside, if there's even a hint of good Cyclops cards in the next block, or *fingers crossed* a Cyclops lord, this
a) might be minorly playable in a tribal deck
b) I'm going to be that much more excited that I pulled a Door of Destinies at the pre-release.

I think there's one more piece a (presumably R/G, or R/W) overcosted big stomp deck is gonna need for Standard constructed: some freaking ramp. Seriously, what did M14 give us to replace Farseek? Lay of the Land? Geez.

posts.post_content: In short: too expensive. I like the art, but the card is a mess. It doesn't make any sense. Why would I care about it not being able to block wimpy creatures, when it's an offensive creature anyway? But for six mana you simply don't get enough bang for the buck. If it would be 5/5, or 5/4 haste, or something like that.

I had two at the pre-release today. I mainboarded them since few people played red. They won me two games (especially when equipped with [Fireshrieker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fireshrieker))!!  
  
Of course, no one would play this beyond limited, but remember the drawback is almost non-existent if you are attacking with a 3-power unblockable creature each turn!
